param.name: CODE_HOME
param.description: the disk drive of the code installation - automatically dectected if none.(change?)

param.name: CODE_DRIVE
param.description: the disk drive of the code installation - automatically dectected if none.(change?)

param.name: REGISTRY_FILE
param.description: the file that keeps the registry information

param.name: PROCESS_FILE
param.description: the the file that keeps the service process information in OSpL

param.name: TEMP_FILE_FOLDER
param.description: the folder to save temporary files

param.name: LOG_FOLDER
param.description: the main system file for logging messages and errors

param.name: LOG_FILE
param.description: the main system file for logging messages and errors

param.name: MAX_LOG_FILE_SIZE
param.description: the maximum size of the log file before it is backed up and started again

param.name: BACKUP_FOLDER
param.description: the main system folder for backing up

param.name: REGISTRY_LOG_FOLDER
param.description: the main registry folder for logging registy related messages

param.name: REGISTRY_LOG_FILE
param.description: the main registry file for logging registy related messages

param.name: REGISTRY_REGISTRATION_FILE
param.description: the main registry file for logging registration related messages

param.name: REGISTRY_SUMMARY_REPORT
param.description: the file to log the registry summary report

param.name: REGISTRY_DETAILED_REPORT
param.description: the file to log the registry detailed report

param.name: PRINT_FOLDER
param.description: the main system folder for printing a string

param.name: PRINT_FILE
param.description: the main system file for printing a sting

param.name: APPEND_PRINT_FILE
param.description: whether to append or overwrite the PrintFile

param.name: MINIMUM_DISKSPACE_TRIGGER
param.description: the minimum disk space before the automatic clean up is triggered to delete temporary files

param.name: MINIMUM_MEMORY_TRIGGER
param.description: the minimum ram memory before the automatic clean up is triggered to get more memory

param.name: CLEAN_UP_FOLDERS
param.description: the folders to clean up

param.name: MAX_JOBIDS_TO_KEEP
param.description: the maximum number of job ids to keep before deleting them

param.name: JOB_MAX_HOURS
param.description: the maximum hours allowed for a job

param.name: JOB_MAX_MINUTES
param.description: the maximum minutes allowed for a job

param.name: JOB_MAX_SECONDS
param.description: the maximum seconds allowed for a job

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MAX_DAYS
param.description: the maximum days allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MAX_HOURS
param.description: the maximum hours allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MAX_MINUTES
param.description: the maximum minutes allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MAX_SECONDS
param.description: the maximum seconds allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MIN_DAYS
param.description: the minimum days allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MIN_HOURS
param.description: the minimum hours allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MIN_MINUTES
param.description: the minimum minutes allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: TEMP_FILE_MIN_SECONDS
param.description: the minimum seconds allowed to keep a temporary file

param.name: CPU_SPEED
param.description: the cpu speed of the server

param.name: MEMORY_SIZE
param.description: the total physical memory of the server

param.name: DISK_SPACE
param.description: the total disk space of the server

param.name: MAX_JOB_NUMBERS
param.description: the maximum number of running jobs allowed per service

param.name: MAX_WAITING_NUMBERS
param.description: the maximum number of waiting jobs allowed per service

param.name: SERVICE_POLLING_INTERVAL_SHORT
param.description: the number of milli-seconds that a service periodically carries out maintentance. It is relatively short

param.name: SERVICE_POLLING_INTERVAL_MEDIUM
param.description: the number of milli-seconds that a service periodically carries out maintentance. It is not too short and nor too long

param.name: SERVICE_POLLING_INTERVAL_LONG
param.description: the number of milli-seconds that a service periodically carries out maintentance. It is relatively long
the full class name (including name space) of the solver

param.name: OS_SOLVER
param.description: the default solver name that the StandardOSSolver uses, e.g. cbc, clp(change?)

param.name: SOLVER_EXECUTABLE
param.description: the solver executable that the StandardOSSolver will launch(change?)

param.name: MAXIMUM_TRIAL_NUMBER_FOR_SOLVE
param.description: the maximum number of trials for a (failed) solve before the service terminates

param.name: MINIMUM_WAIT_TIME_BEFORE_NEXT_TRIAL
param.description: holds the minimum wait time (in milliseconds before the service tries another solve after the last solve

param.name: MAXIMUM_WAIT_TIME_BEFORE_NEXT_TRIAL
param.description: holds the maximum wait time (in milliseconds before the service tries another solve after the last solve

param.name: REQUIRED_DIRECTORIES_AND_FILES
param.description: the required directories and files for invoking the solver's solve method

param.name: DIRECTORIES_TO_MAKE
param.description: the directories to make before invoking the solver's solve method

param.name: FILES_TO_CREATE
param.description: the files to create before invoking the solver's solve method

param.name: SAVE_INPUTS
param.description: whether to save the OSiL and OSoL input arguments of the solve or send method

param.name: PARSE_INSTANCE_INPUT
param.description: whether to parse the OSiL instance input arguments of the solve or send method

param.name: INPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_FROM
param.description: the names of the input files to move from before invoking the solver's solve method. It should countain the same number of files as in INPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_TO

param.name: INPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_TO
param.description: the names of the input files to move to before invoking the solver's solve method. It should countain the same number of files as in INPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_FROM.

param.name: INPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_FROM
param.description: the names of the input files to copy from before invoking the solver's solve method. It should countain the same number of files as in INPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_TO

param.name: INPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_TO
param.description: the names of the input files to copy to before invoking the solver's solve method. It should countain the same number of files as in INPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_FROM

param.name: OUTPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_FROM
param.description: the names of the output files to copy from after the solver's solve method is finished. It should countain the same number of files as in OUTPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_TO.

param.name: OUTPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_TO
param.description: the names of the output files to copy to after the solver's solve method is finished. It should countain the same number of files as in OUTPUT_FILES_TO_COPY_FROM.

param.name: OUTPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_FROM
param.description: the names of the output files to move from after the solver's solve method is finished. It should countain the same number of files as in OUTPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_TO.

param.name: OUTPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_TO
param.description: the names of the output files to move to after the solver's solve method is finished. It should countain the same number of files as in OUTPUT_FILES_TO_MOVE_FROM.

param.name: FILES_TO_DELETE
param.description: the files to delete after the solver's solve method is finished

param.name: DIRECTORIES_TO_DELETE
param.description: the directories to delete after the solver's solve method is finished

param.name: PROCESSES_TO_KILL
param.description: the names of the processes to kill after tge sikver's solve method is finished

param.name: SERVICE_NAME
param.description: the service name (change!)

param.name: SERVICE_EXTENSION
param.description: the service extension

param.name: SERVICE_FOLDER
param.description: the service folder -- automatically detected if none (change!)

param.name: SERVICE_PORT
param.description: the service port -- automatically detected if none; 8080 by default in Tomcat (change!)

param.name: SERVICE_HOST
param.description: the service host - automatically detected if none, e.g. http://123.45.67.89(change!)

param.name: SERVICE_URI
param.description: the service uri - automatically constructed if none, e.g. http://123.45.67.89:8080/os/OSSolverService.jws

param.name: SERVICE_TYPE
param.description: the service type

param.name: OS_REGISTRY_SITE
param.description: the site of the OS Registry - automatically constructed if none

param.name: OS_SCHEDULER_SITE
param.description: the site of the OS scheduler - automatically constructed if none

param.name: SCHEDULER_WITH_REGISTRY
param.description: whether the scheduler service locally sits with the registry service in the same web application

param.name: SMTP_SERVER
param.description: the smtp server address to send the email (change!)

param.name: FROM_EMAIL
param.description: the from email address to send the email (change!)

param.name: FROM_PASSWORD
param.description: the from email address to send the email (change!)

param.name: TO_EMAIL
param.description: the to email address to send the email (change!)

param.name: MAIL_SUBJECT
param.description: the email subject

param.name: MAIL_MESSAGE
param.description: the email message body

param.name: REQUIRE_USER_NAME
param.description: whether the service needs user name to be submitted

param.name: REQUIRE_PASSWORD
param.description: whether the service needs a password for each user

param.name: REQUIRE_LICENSE
param.description: whether the service needs a license number for each user

param.name: REQUIRE_ONLY_JOB_ID_TO_RETRIEVE_JOB_RESULT
param.description: holds whether only the job id (no user name/password/license) is needed to retrieve a job result

param.name: REQUIRE_ONLY_JOB_ID_TO_KILL_JOB
param.description: holds whether only the job id (no user name/password/license) is needed to kill a job

param.name: MAX_JOBS_PER_USER
param.description: the maximum number of active jobs a user can run

param.name: USER_NAMES
param.description: all the user names

param.name: PASSWORDS
param.description: the passwords for all the users

param.name: LICENSES
param.description: the licenses for all the users

param.name: ALLOW_IO_OPERATIONS_BY_USERS
param.description: whether the users can carry out io operations (through option files)

param.name: VALIDATE
param.description: whether the parser should be validating against the xml schema or not

param.name: XML_INDENTING
param.description: whether to write out the xml indented

param.name: FML_PUBLIC_SITE
param.description: the value of the FML schema public site

param.name: OS_SITE
param.description: the site of optimizationservices.org

param.name: OS_SCHEMA_SITE
param.description: the value of the OSxL schema's public site

param.name: XML_ENCODING_STYLE
param.description: the xml encoding style

param.name: XSLT_LOCATION
param.description: the location of XSLT; no XSLT file name should be there
